3434    def setMultiple(self,words,phonemes):
3435        "Sets phonemes for words, returning dict of word to substitute word.  Flushes file buffer before return."
3436        avail = [] ; needed = []
3437        for word,pos,phon in self.usable_words(words):
3438            avail.append((len(phon),word,pos,phon))
3439        for word,phon in zip(words,phonemes):
3440            needed.append((len(phon),word,phon))
3441        avail.sort() ; needed.sort() # shortest phon first
3442        i = 0 ; wDic = {} ; iDone=set() ; mustBeAlpha=True
3443        # mustBeAlpha: prefer alphabetical words, since
3444        # these can be capitalised at start of sentence
3445        # (the prosody doesn't always work if it isn't)
3446        for l,word,phon in needed:
3447            while avail[i][0] < l or (mustBeAlpha and not re.match(as_utf8("[A-Za-z]"),avail[i][1])) or i in iDone:
3448                i += 1
3449                if i==len(avail):
3450                    if mustBeAlpha: # desperate situation: we HAVE to use the non-alphabetical slots now (ideally we should pick words that never occur at start of sentence for them, but this branch is hopefully a rare situation in practice)
3451                       mustBeAlpha=False ; i=0; continue
3452                    sys.stderr.write("Could not find enough lexicon slots!\n") # TODO: we passed 'words' to usable_words's words_ok_to_redefine - this might not be the case if we didn't find enough slots
3453                    self.dFile.flush() ; return wDic
3454            iDone.add(i)
3455            _,wSubst,pos,oldPhon = avail[i] ; i += 1
3456            if avail[i][2] in self.restoreDic: oldPhon=None # shouldn't happen if setMultiple is called only once, but might be useful for small experiments in the Python interpreter etc
3457            self.set(pos,phon,oldPhon)
3458            wDic[word] = wSubst[:1].upper()+wSubst[1:] # always capitalise it so it can be used at start of sentence too (TODO: copy original capitalisation of each instance instead, in case it happens to come directly after a dotted abbreviation? although if it's something that's always capitalised anyway, e.g. most names, then this won't make any difference)
3459        self.dFile.flush() ; return wDic

Sets phonemes for words, returning dict of word to substitute word. Flushes file buffer before return.

def set(self, phPos, val, old=None): 
3460    def set(self,phPos,val,old=None):
3461        """Sets phonemes at position phPos to new value.
3462        Caller should flush the file buffer when done."""
3463        # print "Debugger: setting %x to %s" % (phPos,val)
3464        if old:
3465            assert not phPos in self.restoreDic, "Cannot call set() twice on same phoneme while re-specifying 'old'"
3466            assert len(val) <= len(old), "New phoneme is too long!"
3467            self.restoreDic[phPos] = old
3468        else: assert phPos in self.restoreDic, "Must specify old values (for restore) when setting for first time"
3469        self.dFile.seek(phPos)
3470        getBuf(self.dFile).write(val+as_utf8(chr(0)))

Sets phonemes at position phPos to new value. Caller should flush the file buffer when done.

def close(self): 
3475    def close(self):
3476        for phPos,val in self.restoreDic.items():
3477            self.set(phPos,val)
3478        self.dFile.close()
3479        del MacBritish_System_Lexicon.instances[self.voice]
3480        assert not os.system("rm -f /tmp/"+self.voice+".PCMWave.lock")
3481        self.voice=None
def stdout_width_unix(): 
3482def stdout_width_unix(): # assumes isatty
3483   import struct,fcntl,termios
3484   return struct.unpack('hh', fcntl.ioctl(1,termios.TIOCGWINSZ,'1234'))[1]
lexFormats = {'festival': {'0': 47, b'0': 47, 47: '0', '1': 47.1, b'1': 47.1, 47.1: '1', '2': 47.2, b'2': 47.2, 47.2: '2', 'aa': 1, b'aa': 1, 1: 'aa', 'a': 2, b'a': 2, 2: 'a', 'uh': 3, b'uh': 3, 3: 'uh', 'o': 4, b'o': 4, 4: 'o', 'au': 5, b'au': 5, 5: 'au', '@': 6, b'@': 6, 6: '@', '@@': 7, b'@@': 7, 7: '@@', 'ai': 8, b'ai': 8, 8: 'ai', 'b': 9, b'b': 9, 9: 'b', 'ch': 10, b'ch': 10, 10: 'ch', 'd': 11, b'd': 11, 11: 'd', 'dh': 12, b'dh': 12, 12: 'dh', 'e': 13, b'e': 13, 13: 'e', 7.1: '@@', 'e@': 14, b'e@': 14, 14: 'e@', 'ei': 15, b'ei': 15, 15: 'ei', 'f': 16, b'f': 16, 16: 'f', 'g': 17, b'g': 17, 17: 'g', 'h': 18, b'h': 18, 18: 'h', 'i': 19, b'i': 19, 19: 'i', 'i@': 20, b'i@': 20, 20: 'i@', 'ii': 21, b'ii': 21, 21: 'ii', 'jh': 22, b'jh': 22, 22: 'jh', 'k': 23, b'k': 23, 23: 'k', 'l': 24, b'l': 24, 24: 'l', 'm': 25, b'm': 25, 25: 'm', 'n': 26, b'n': 26, 26: 'n', 'ng': 27, b'ng': 27, 27: 'ng', 'ou': 28, b'ou': 28, 28: 'ou', 'oi': 30, b'oi': 30, 30: 'oi', 'p': 31, b'p': 31, 31: 'p', 'r': 32, b'r': 32, 32: 'r', 's': 33, b's': 33, 33: 's', 'sh': 34, b'sh': 34, 34: 'sh', 't': 35, b't': 35, 35: 't', 'th': 36, b'th': 36, 36: 'th', 'u@': 37, b'u@': 37, 37: 'u@', 'u': 37.2, b'u': 37.2, 37.2: 'u', 'uu': 39, b'uu': 39, 39: 'uu', 'oo': 40, b'oo': 40, 40: 'oo', 'v': 41, b'v': 41, 41: 'v', 'w': 42, b'w': 42, 42: 'w', 'y': 43, b'y': 43, 43: 'y', 'z': 44, b'z': 44, 44: 'z', 'zh': 45, b'zh': 45, 45: 'zh', ('settings', 'doc'): "Festival's British voice", ('settings', 'lex_filename'): '/Users/ryan/.festivalrc', ('settings', 'lex_entry_format'): '(lex.add.entry \'( "%s" n %s))\n', ('settings', 'lex_header'): ';; ('settings', 'safe_to_drop_characters'): True, ('settings', 'cleanup_func'): <function festival_group_stress>, 'ae': 2, b'ae': 2, 'ah': 3, b'ah': 3, 'ax': 6, b'ax': 6, 'aw': 5, b'aw': 5, 'er': 7, def chr(x): 
2560   def chr(x): return bytes([x])
def sorted(l, theCmp=None): 
2563   def sorted(l,theCmp=None):
2564      if theCmp:
2565         return _builtin_sorted(l,key=cmp_to_key(theCmp))
2566      else: return _builtin_sorted(l)
